properties.description: Tours and rentals
properties.notes: The only provider on the Rahway river

properties.address: Hylan Blvd & Satterlee St, Staten Island
properties.description: The site of a legendary display of American defiance early in the Revolutionary War, and the southernmost point in the State. A long (800 feet) but well-paved pedestrian path offers access to the Arthur Kill and Raritan Bay.
properties.safety: Many semi-submerged pilings north and south of launch, and a major shipping channel 400 yards offshore.

properties.description: Sandy beach
properties.safety: Watch for commercial traffic

properties.description: concrete ramp with service dock. Adjacent to parking.
properties.safety: Marina-adjacent; watch for powerboats

properties.description: Concrete ramp with service dock
properties.safety: Watch for ships, tugs, powerboats of all description

properties.description: Concrete ramp with service dock
properties.safety: Watch for commerical traffic

properties.description: This reclaimed cement manufacturing site offers a concrete launch ramp to the Bronx River. There is limited street parking and a long carry from either the entrance at Westchester Avenue (.25 mi.) or Bruckner Boulevard (.15 mi).
properties.safety: A boom collects debris and helps prevent motorized traffic from going north; to the south are strong currents and a working shipping channel.
properties.waterbody: Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound

properties.address: Edgewater Rd & Lafayette Ave, The Bronx
properties.description: A gravel beach offers access to the sheltered waters of the Bronx River. Portage is about 200 ft. on an asphalt path.
properties.safety: A half mile north, a boom collects debris and helps prevent motorized traffic from going north; to the south are strong currents and a working shipping channel.
properties.waterbody: Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound
Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound
Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound
Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound

properties.address: Grand Central Pkwy & Northern Blvd, Queens
properties.description: Access to Flushing Bay via a dock, submerged at high tide, at the eastern end of World's Fair Marina. If locked, the key is at Pete's Backyard on Pier 1.
properties.safety: Watch footing on the steep ramp and slippery dock, mud banks at low tide, heavy motorized traffic, and 100-yard security perimeter around LaGuardia Airport.
properties.waterbody: Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound

properties.description: Launch from a concrete ramp on a cobble beach near the parking lot or a sandy cove at the east end of the park.
properties.safety: Strong tidal currents and heavy traffic in the main shipping channel; restricted access on both Brother Islands (bird sanctuaries) and prohibited at Rikers Island (city's largest jail.)
properties.waterbody: Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound

properties.description: A concrete ramp near the marina and fishing pier offers direct access to Little Neck Bay; the wetlands of Alley Pond Park and Udall's Cove are a short paddle away. Parking and footbridge access at 28th Avenue.
properties.safety: Landing at high tide can be difficult heading south toward Alley Pond Park due to extensive riprap.
properties.waterbody: Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound

properties.address: Foot of Sound View Ave, The Bronx
properties.description: A concrete ramp provides access to the marshes of Pugsley Creek, the East River, the Hutchinson River drainage, and Long Island Sound. Portage is 150 feet.
properties.safety: Strong currents in the East River, heavy commercial traffic, and lots of broken glass in launch area.
properties.waterbody: Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound

properties.description: Located beneath the Bronx-Whitestone Bridge, the beach is an ideal launch for exploring the easternmost reaches of the East River. Portage is about two blocks from on-street parking.
properties.safety: Strong Currents, passing ships and barges raise large wakes, and there is a 25-yard security perimeter around the bridge towers.
properties.waterbody: Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound
Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound

properties.description: A natural beach on the west side of Fort Totten peninsula is an excellent spot from which to explore Little Neck and Eastchester Bays. Portage is about 40 feet.
properties.safety: Currents are strong away from the shore, especially in the main shipping lane; heavy pleasure boat traffic on weekends
properties.waterbody: Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound
Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound

properties.description: A small 10' by 15' foot dock (150 foot portage) offers easy access to the middle section of the Bronx River, six miles north of its confluence with the East River. Bathrooms and water in nearby playground.
properties.safety: The Bronx River has several dams with portage points, a weir that can most safely be cleared at least two hours before or after low tide, and a DEP debris boom that floats just on the surface of the water but spans the river and needs to be cleared.
properties.waterbody: Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound

properties.address: O'Brien Ave & Leland Ave, The Bronx
properties.description: Enter the park and make a left off the main path to an asphalt ramp located near the confluence of the Bronx River and East River (about a three block portage from street parking.) The area offers expansive views of the rivers, migratory birds and the di
properties.safety: Barge traffic and other motor boats.
properties.waterbody: Bronx River + Western Long Island Sound

properties.description: A small beach offers access to the east channel of the East River. Portage is 10 ft. Facilities at Socrates Sculpture Park.
properties.safety: Even experts can be intimidated by the swift currents of the East River and turbulent waters of Hell Gate.
properties.waterbody: East River + Harlem River + Newtown Creek
East River + Harlem River + Newtown Creek

properties.description: This new pocket park has a floating dock on Newtown Creek providing access to the Creek and East River. There is a combination lock on the gate to the dock; access is available to boaters with NYC Parks launch permit.
properties.safety: Commercial traffic; water not suitable for swimming
properties.waterbody: East River + Harlem River + Newtown Creek
East River + Harlem River + Newtown Creek

properties.program_name: Brooklyn Bridge Park Boathouse, Brooklyn Kayak Guides
properties.description: The launch here, in a small city park, is a gravel beach ringed by amphitheater seating on the east side of the cove between the Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridges. Car drop off is close--about 150 feet--but on-street parking in DUMBO is difficult.
properties.safety: A powerful backeddy makes for easy paddling in the cove, but currents outside are powerful. Large, slippery rocks make launching and landing at low tide a trial, and big wakes can create surf-like conditions on the beach.
properties.waterbody: East River + Harlem River + Newtown Creek

properties.description: The floating dock operated by Downtown Boathouse is right off the waterslide esplanade at this park on the former site of the NY Central Freight Yard. Parking is on city streets, leaving a lengthy portage that involves descending a long stone staircase.
properties.safety: Sunken boats and debris can be obstacles at low tide. ONLY experienced paddlers in Harlem River Ã¢â¬â dangerous currents!

properties.description: Tiered steps go straight into the water at a wastewater treatment plant, operated by the NYC Department of Environmental Protection, which provides access to explore the industrial banks of Newtown Creek.

properties.description: This street-end launch offers good access to the bucolic Harlem River.
properties.safety: Local college crews row on the Harlem River.

properties.description: Concrete ramp with service docks AND JetDock floating launch dock

properties.description: paved/gravel ramp at end of parking lot
properties.safety: BE AWARE OF TIDES! There is an average of two hours either side of High Tide when this site us usable. Use New Milford and Teaneck data. One can easily get stuck in mud.

properties.description: concrete ramp close to parking & next to dog park
properties.notes: Perfect base for exploration of Mill Creek Marsh

properties.address: Beach 88th St & Beach Channel Dr, Queens

properties.description: Put in at the sand beach on the east side of the popular 600-foot fishing pier. Seasonal walk-up kayaking is offered by National Park Service Rangers.
A 1933 seaplane ramp provides access to southwestern Jamaica Bay. Landing on the islands (part of the Jamaica Bay Wildlife Refuge) is permitted below the high-tide line only. Permit is required.
properties.safety: U nderwater obstacles on southeastern side of ramp; heavy boat traffic and strong currents in offshore channel.

properties.description: There is a 300 -footcarryfrom easy parking to a wooden dock maintained by the Sebago Canoe Club. Launch through the club's open paddle program or membership. Non-member paddlers are allowed to land.
properties.safety: Paddling in groups is recommended in Jamaica Bay

properties.description: Access to Norton Basin and the eastern end of Jamaica Bay is provided by this beach launch.
properties.safety: Launch perpendicular, as large, jagged rocks protrude along shoreline; extensive mud flats at low tide.
The tides and currents of Jamaica Bay can change suddenly.ÃÂ  Experienced paddlers strongly suggested.

properties.description: A narrow ramp offers access to a 160-acre nature preserve just east of JFK airport. The bird watching is excellent in terrain that ranges from freshwater wetlands to marsh islands to a large expanse of open water.
properties.safety: Launching is difficult at low tide due to extensive mud flats; and the ramp can be slippery.

properties.description: The marina sits on a protected arm of Jamaica Bay, whose 16,000 acres of open water, salt marshes, and beaches form the bulk of Gateway National Recreational Area.
properties.safety: Jet skis are allowed in Mill Basin. Paddling in groups is recommended

properties.description: Best launch is the trail on  the left approximately 100 yards to the beach through high marsh grass and dunes. Pit toilet located 150 yards away on the runway.
properties.safety:
Heavy boat traffic cruising out of Mill Basin Channel. Shallow marshes and sand bars near the Mill

Basin Bridge.

properties.address: Cross Bay Blvd & Addabbo Bridge, Queens
properties.description: The sand beach launch on the eastside goes in the Grassy Bay portion of Jamaica Bay, a popular kayak fishing destination, west side launch opens to Pumpkin Patch Channel and North Channel.
properties.safety: Heavy pleasure boat traffic in Jamaica Bay, stay clear of channels. This is a wildlife refuge, do not land on islands nor disturb flora or fauna.

properties.address: East of Exit 9 Eastbound Belt Pkwy, Brooklyn
properties.description: Calm waters and strong winds make the sand beach a favorite take off for w indsurfers and kite boarders. Launching is recommended at higher tide as mud flats make the walk to water several hundred yards at low tide. Permit is required.
properties.safety: Do not disturb the horseshoe crabs in this prime breeding area. Challenging wind and tide conditions. Watch for glass on the beach.

properties.description: A 40-foot portage leads to a rocky launch area at the head of Gerritsen Inlet. Nearby destinations include Plumb Beach, Dead Horse Bay, and Rockaway Inlet.
properties.safety: Heavy motor boat traffic from Gerritsen Beach; conditions in Rockaway Inlet can be challenging
The tides and currents of Jamaica Bay can change suddenly.ÃÂ  Paddling experience strongly suggested.
The tides and currents of Jamaica Bay can change suddenly.ÃÂ  Paddling experience strongly suggested.

properties.description: Sandy beach
A floating dock at the boat ramp offers acces to Great Kills Harbor and a nice shoreline of beach, dunes and grasslands. A parking permit is required at the trailer lot.
properties.safety: Heavy pleasure boat traffic and commercial traffic in the offshore shipping lanes.

properties.address: Seguine Ave & Johnston Terrace, Staten Island
properties.description: Two beach launches provide access to Raritan Bay. Portage is 40 feet at Sharrott Avenue, 150 feet at Seguine Avenue.
properties.safety: Watch for fishing lines from the pier at Sharrott Avenue, the remains of a pier at Seguine Avenue, a marked channel in Lemon Creek, and a buoyed channel close to shore.

properties.description: Multiple bay beach launch areas along the SH peninsula
properties.safety: Be aware of high winds, powerboats

properties.description: A good launch for experienced paddlers wishing to explore the Upper Harbor. The public dock, operated by the Downtown Boathouse, is about 120 yards out on the south side of the pier. NY Kayak Company and Village Community Boathouse are based here. Car dr
properties.safety: Currents are strong at the pierhead line; 25-yard security zone around the Holland Tunnel ventilator shaft.

properties.description: The boathouse is operated by NYRiverSports and hosts the programs of New York Kayak Polo, Manhattan Kayak Company, NY Outrigger and Hudson River Community Sailing. Launching and landing only when the boathouse is open. The nearest parking is at Chelsea P
properties.safety: River currents are strong.

properties.description: A wooden dock connected to the pier by a gangway and accessible when the boathouse, maintained by Floating the Apple, is open. Paid parking on Pier 83.
properties.safety: Currents on the Hudson move swiftly; the security zone at the cruise ship terminal extends 100 yards out from the pierhead line

properties.description: The dock at the Clinton Cove boathouse is operated by Downtown Boathouse, open weekends and holidays. Boats can be dropped on the service road to the West Side Highway, leaving a 200-foot carry.

properties.safety: The cove behind the pier is protected, but there are strong currents on the Hudson, with turbulence udner the George Washington Bridge and at Spuyten Duyvil (the mouth of the Harlem River).

properties.description: This former summer camp, north of George Washington Bridge, features a small beach landing backed bya  rock seawall to the east of the large playground.

properties.description: This landing-only site is a small floating dock on the north side of Pier 101, on the northeastern corner of the island. Kayaks must be carried up a gangway with the two sharp turns and left on the grass at the top. The Downtown Boathouse runs walk-up ka
properties.safety: Busy shipping channels surround the island, and Pier 101 sees multiple ferry landings every hour. Kayak visitors must be aware of traffic and currents, and should carry and be familiar with VHF radio.

properties.description: Dock maintained by the Gowanus Dredgers Canoe Club is a good starting point for exploring Brooklyn's Industrial waterfront. No facilities
properties.safety: The canal is a narrow commercial channel; water is not suitable for swimming.

properties.description: This small beach next to the boat ramp on the south side of the 1100-acre park offers a good spot from which to explore the west side of the Upper Harbor. It's a half-mile paddle to nearby salt marshes and about a mile to the Satue of Liberty. Portage is
properties.safety: Mudflats at low tide off Caven Point Beach to the south, heavy power boat use, and security zones and steady ferry traffic all year at Liberty and Ellis Islands.

properties.description: A gravel beach provides access to Buttermilk Channel and Upper New York Bay. Weekend paddling programs are offered by Red Hook Boaters. Portage from easy street parking is about 50 yards. Restrooms at nearby Fairway Market.
properties.safety: Watch for fishing lines, swift currents off the end of the pier, commercial traffic and a 100-yard security zone around the cruise ship terminal.

properties.address: Hylan Blvd & Edgewater St, Staten Island
properties.description: The park, historic house and sandy beach are an appealing destination and offer an excellent departure point to explore the Lower Harbor. A portage of about 400 feet from on-street parking.
properties.safety: Watch for a gas pipeline to the west, jagged rocks at low tide, and significant curretns and commercial shipping traffic in the Narrows.
